Academic Computing and Communications Center     Search the site     Toggle Menu      Search                  Academic Computing and Communications Center      Academic Computing and Communications Center   Main Menu    Services           Communication and Collaboration    Computing Services    Infrastructure    Professional Services    Research    Security    Teaching and Learning         Support           Academic Continuity    Academic Multimedia Lab and Lightboard Studio    ARC Helpdesk    C-Stop BSB    C-Stop LHS    Daley Library Helpdesk    LTS Support Office         Service Status           Service Notices         News           All News         Forms    About           Identity    Leadership    Policies    Reports    Jobs          Eyebrow menu    WebStore    Online Training    Answers    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map       Search                     Available To       description   Students  Individuals enrolled in course(s) at the University of Illinois at Chicago with a valid UIC NetID, including online or taking classes at a satellite campus.  Faculty  Individuals teaching course(s) at the University of Illinois at Chicago with a valid UIC NetID, including online or at a satellite campus.  Staff  Full or part-time employees of the University of Illinois at Chicago with a valid UIC NetID.  External Affiliates  Individuals who work with the University of Illinois at Chicago but do not have a valid UIC NetID.  Designated  Some tools or services are available only to designated individuals who are enrolled and provided with specific access level rights.   Delegate authority liaisons can assign all liaison roles, including adding and removing other delegate authority liaisons by using this application. Delegate Authorities need to be manually added to their unit by another Delegate Authority or by contacting ACCC.  Phonebook Contact (PbContact) liaisons are responsible for maintaining directory information for employees and their unit listing in the UIC Directory. PbContacts are also responsible for creating NetIDs for new employees and adding/removing employees from their unit.  REACH stands for “Resident Experts Are Convenient Help”. These liaisons are typically the go-to people within the unit for technical assistance such as getting a computer on to the network or helping the unit get on to the wireless network, help with anti-virus recommendations, assign IP addresses and DNS names.
